author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Actor Jussie Smollett made a $50,000 payment to a local Chicago charity to settle the city’s lawsuit against him, according to a Friday statement. The legal battle stemmed from Smollett’s false police report in 2019 claiming he had been the victim of a hate crime.  “I’ve made a $50,000.00 donation to Building Brighter Futures (BBF)…
title: Jussie Smollett donates to Chicago charity in city settlement

author: Sharon Udasin
description: The Trump administration on Friday authorized the relaunch of operations at a southeastern Utah uranium mine — marking its first use of a newly fast-tracked environmental review process. The Velvet-Wood mine, set to be reopened by Canadian company Anfield Energy, contains both uranium and vanadium, a mineral used to strengthen steel equipment in cars, building…
title: Trump administration approves first expedited uranium mining project

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: The Pentagon on Friday pushed back on a Wall Street Journal report that the Trump administration is considering withdrawing thousands of American troops from South Korea, calling the news “not true.”  The Journal on Thursday first reported that the Defense Department was developing an option to pull out roughly 4,500 troops and move them to other…
title: Pentagon denies US considering withdrawing troops from South Korea

author: Filip Timotija
description: Both the U.S. and Iran indicated Friday that the two countries are moving closer to reaching a new deal regarding Tehran’s expanding nuclear program. Omani Foreign Minister Badr bin Hamad Al Busaidi, who is the acting mediator, said the fifth round of talks in Rome ended with “some but not conclusive progress.”   “We hope to…
title: US, Iran say they’re moving closer to nuclear deal after fifth round of talks

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Friday revived his trade war, threatening to slap hefty tariffs on the European Union (E.U.) and to hit Apple with tariffs if it doesn’t manufacture in the United States. His moves represented an about-face after weeks in which markets had rallied to Trump’s pausing of his “Liberation Day” tariffs on much of…
title: Trump revives trade war despite economic, political risks

author: Joseph Choi
description: President Trump’s former surgeon general, Jerome Adams, said this week that failure to maintain certain requirements for the role he once occupied would compromise the “mission and credibility” of the federal public health service. Trump’s current nominee for the role, Casey Means, graduated from medical school but did not complete her residency, meaning she is…
title: Trump’s former surgeon general calls for maintaining qualifications current nominee doesn’t have

author: Ella Lee
description: Chief Justice John Roberts temporarily halted discovery Friday in a lawsuit seeking access to documents and information about the Department of Government Efficiency’s (DOGE) operations. In a brief order, Roberts granted the government’s request for an administrative stay, which temporarily lifts a judge’s order allowing limited discovery into whether DOGE is an “agency.” If it…
title: Chief Justice Roberts temporarily halts discovery in DOGE case

author: Ruth Bauer, opinion contributor
description: Higher education institutions can help students avoid years of trial and error by offering personalized career coaching that guides them towards their first jobs, which can serve as a launchpad to career success.
title: A college degree is not the same thing as a career plan

author: Alaina Papazian
description: Two Florida parents were recently jailed for not ensuring their children were attending school.
title: Florida parents jailed for children’s poor attendance

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Republicans say they’re going to rewrite the 1,116-page bill the House narrowly passed Thursday to enact President Trump’s agenda. Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) urged GOP senators at a meeting Tuesday to keep their changes to the bill as minimal as possible to avoid wrecking the delicate compromises he cobbled together in the House to…
title: These are the changes Senate Republicans are eyeing for the GOP’s ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Rachel Frazin
description: President Trump on Friday signed executive orders that aim to bolster nuclear power, including by scaling back environmental reviews. The president signed four orders, including one that directs an evaluation of whether the Nuclear Regulatory Commission is too cautious in terms of acceptable levels of radiation exposure. Trump’s orders also are expected to require the…
title: Trump signs orders to boost nuclear power, including reduced environmental review

author: Barzin Jafartash Amiri, opinion contributor
description: Iranians, regardless of their grievances, appear to prioritize national cohesion when confronted with external or catastrophic events.
title: Don’t invade Iran: Trump must avoid Saddam’s mistake

author: Saul Elbein
description: A hawk in a New Jersey town has learned to use a neighborhood traffic light to hunt more effectively, a study published Thursday found. The study in Frontiers of Ethology represents further evidence of how certain bird species have adapted to urban life in surprising ways. “The behavior described here is an impressive feat of intelligence,” the…
title: Urban hawks may use traffic lights to ambush prey, study finds

author: Nick Sargen, opinion contributor
description: The biggest concern for policymakers in Southeast Asia is that they are caught in the crosshairs of the U.S.-China trade conflict.
title: Asian economies are the collateral damage of the US-China trade war

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: A federal judge on Friday temporarily blocked the Trump administration’s decision to revoke Harvard University’s certification to enroll foreign students.  Within hours of Harvard filing suit against the move, Boston-based U.S. District Judge Allison Burroughs agreed to halt the revocation until she can receive further arguments. She scheduled a May 29 hearing on whether to grant a…
title: Judge temporarily blocks Trump administration’s foreign students ban at Harvard

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is walking back the timeline on his promise to find the cause of autism spectrum disorder. Kennedy said during an interview with CNN late Thursday that the new deadline will be around March of next year at the earliest. Kennedy was pressed on…
title: RFK Jr. softens pledge to find autism cause by September

author: Filip Timotija
description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the current 10 percent tariffs imposed across the board are not increasing prices on consumers. “The world has a 10 percent tariff now,” Lutnick told NewsNation’s “CUOMO” in an interview Thursday night. “So, the way it actually runs through the markets is that the selling countries overseas, they eat most…
title: Lutnick: Current 10 percent tariffs not increasing prices

description: The Trump administration should be careful not to repeat President Biden’s mistakes.

title: Bessent: Trump tariff threat should ‘light fire’ under EU

description: China’s regime, by surreptitiously including suspicious components in Chinese equipment, has only itself to blame for the proposed restriction.

author: Filip Timotija
description: Rep. Tim Burchett (R-Tenn.) said during a recent interview that he does not use straws, telling Fox News that is “what women in my house do.”  Fox News producer Johnny Belisario asked GOP lawmakers in both chambers of Congress on Thursday about host Jesse Watters’ “rules for men.” “He says men should not drink out…

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Democratic National Committee (DNC) members will determine in June whether a contested election over two DNC vice chair positions should be held again. Members of the DNC’s Rules and Bylaws Committee met Thursday night, determining that the party will hold an electronic vote June 9-11 over whether the election for DNC vice chair positions won…
title: DNC members to vote next month on potential vice chair election redo

description: Congress must act to raise the interest deduction to 50 percent and use the more generous EBITDA calculation to alleviate the burden on American businesses and allow them to continue investing in their future and creating jobs.

description: Federal taxpayers in fiscally responsible states were subsidizing the excesses of states that refused to rein in their own tax-and-spend habits.

description: President Trump on Friday criticized the United Kingdom’s energy policy, pushing the British government to do away with “costly and unsightly” windmills and drill for more oil in the North Sea. “Our negotiated deal with the United Kingdom is working out well for all. I strongly recommend to them, however, that in order to get…

author: Filip Timotija
description: Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Secretary Kristi Noem welcomed the dismissal of a lawsuit against the department for sending migrants to Guantanamo Bay.  “Suck it,” Noem said Thursday night in a post on social media platform X. She attached a copy of the court filing confirming that the 10 migrants who brought the lawsuit have…

description: China heavily criticized the Trump administration’s decision Thursday to bar Harvard University from enrolling international students and vowed that Beijing will protect the rights of its students studying overseas.  “China-U.S. education cooperation benefits both sides. China opposes politicizing education cooperation. What the U.S. seeks to do will undoubtedly hurt its own image and reputation in…

description: A terrorist gunman killed two staff members of Israel's Embassy in Washington, D.C., highlighting the dangers of antisemitic rhetoric and the importance of resilience in the face of persecution.
